title: Columbia Banking, Umpqua Bank to Merge in $5 Billion Deal
sub_head: The combined bank will be one of the largest with headquarters on the West Coast, with more than $50 billion in assets
body:
Columbia Banking System Inc. and Umpqua Holdings Corp. said Tuesday they would merge in a roughly $5 billion all-stock deal that creates one of the largest based on the West Coast.
The combined entity will boast more than $50 billion in assets, with its largest presence in Washington, California and Oregon. Columbia, based in Tacoma, Wash., is the smaller of the two banks and the acquirer in the deal, and Columbia Chief Executive Clint Stein will lead the new bank. The new company will operate under the Umpqua Bank brand and have headquarters in the Portland, Ore., area, where Umpqua is based, the companies said.
